title: When a person dies, all wealth goes to sons & females are expected to gift or forgive their share?
transcript:
[Questioner] from Kashmir there is 
this weird culture is going on in   our community that when a person dies all of 
his wealth is taken by the male I mean Sons   and they give nothing to the daughters now through 
the course of time people are becoming aware   of the fact that sisters also have a right 
in the inheritance of father in the wealth   but there still be a stigma like in which our 
women face so whenever we tell our sisters that   you have a right in whatever our father has left 
because he has died so they tell us no no we don't   need it's it's like we forgive you and it's a 
gift from us so my question Sheikh can we take   this feeling that they have gifted up yet or there 
is another rule says that a person cannot gift or   give charity his wealth except for the one third 
party so which among these two should we say so if I understood question he's 
talking about a prevailing   custom in the community where females are 
deprived from inheriting so if the father   dies the sons get all the property in order the 
wealth and they deprive the girls the daughters   with the understanding that because this 
daughter if she gets married to a stranger   he would have a share in our father's property 
this should be only in our lineage in our family   of course this is from jahiliyah this is a major 
sin and a prohibited act in a transgression and   disbelief in the Quran because the one who divided 
the wealth of the deceased is no one other than   Allah and Allah knows who's worthy of inheriting 
from those who are to be deprived so when you come   and deprive the daughters from inheriting 
you have committed a grave and major sin   now after people the grace of Allah came to know 
the ruling they started wanting to give back   and to correct the wrong doing so they went to 
their sisters and said listen we deprived it from   your rights here is your share but most likely 
these sisters are so loving and kind and generous   they're married and they're happy with their 
family and they say no it's okay we forgive you   so is it permissible the answer is yes as 
long as they were wronged and Injustice was   acted upon them and then they forgave   the oppressors and the wrong doers alhamdulillah 
this is permissible and Allah Knows Best and have you ever taken a counseling session with 
me go to my website and you will find counseling   sessions and apply for one if you can afford it 
that's good for you if you cannot you're entitled   for one free session and this is for everybody 
if they can affirm by Allah that they cannot   afford it because they're poor I'll give them 
one free session without a problem a full half   an hour so come to me and let's speak about 
it inshallah within the following two days   or three days I will uh try and seek Allah's 
guidance to solve the problem once and for All
